column4: Skutr34, I dont' think it is a good idea to shrink Windows partitions. You may lose data in the process. Windows uses the FAT  File Allocation Table to keep track of the disk space and other things.
lol
well i know how much is being used
my linux partition is only 10gb
im not overlapping
i have a 220gb windows partition and only 104gb is being used
therefore as long as i leave some extra space for windows i should be fine on data
i have LVM in fedora.....
i just want to give some space to fedora
how would i do that?
im on a laptop so would it be ok to run one of the os's on an external harddrive?
i dont want to open the laptop though.... would an external work?
also would i have to reinstall linux to move it to the external?
would i have to reinstall linux to move it to the external drive>
not a bad idea
those things are like 100 dollars
it would be cheaper to buy an external drive
lol ill ask my parents (hint, hint
ik
i just dont want to spend 100 dollars on something i already have in my pants xD
i apologize :)
ok so for now i think ill shrink windows a bit until i can get something like a shtick or an external drive
lol god i hate backups
but i gotta go thanks for the help, and yeah lol
